* Duke is a command line application that lets users store tasks they wish to track.
* We have here our driver class which initialize other main components of the app.
* A constructor which takes instantiates other components.
* @param filePath Path name of the file we want to load.
* Handles the printing of welcome and exit messages.
* Running of app is abstracted by a method to keep things simple here.
* Main is the driver function that creates an instance of Duke for running.
* @param args Command line arguments, simply here by convention.
* Deals with making sense of the user command.
* Parse commands and decide on how to handle them accordingly.
* @param text String of text describing our command.
* @param tasks The existing list of tasks.
public void handleTaskCommand(String text, TaskList tasks) {
throw new InvalidInstructionException("You have entered invalid input.");
* Storage components which handles loading and saving of file.
// deals with loading tasks from the file and saving tasks in the file
* @param filePath Path of file we interact with.
* @return TaskList which is an abstraction of our task list.
TaskList tasks = new TaskList(new ArrayList<Task>(), true);
* Saves our tasks in a file associated with this storage object.
* @param tasks List of tasks to be saved.
* Represents a task user wants to complete by a certain time and date.
* @param description How the user describes the task.
* @param by Time by which user has to complete task.
* Returns the deadline task in a nice format suitable for printing.
* @return String representing the details of the deadline.
String formatDateTime = by.format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("dd LLL yyyy HH:mma"));
* Represents a task occurring at a certain place.
* @param description How the user describes the task.
* @param at Location where the task takes place.
* An abstraction of what something the user wants to do.
* Implements Serializable to be saved as a stream of bytes.
protected static List<Task> taskList = new ArrayList<>(100);
* @param description How the user describes the task.
* Getter for description of the task.
* Returns an string icon that suggests if a task is completed.
* @return String that is either a tick or cross.
// return (isDone ? "[\u2713]" : "[\u2718]"); // return tick or X symbols
return (isDone ? "[✓]" : "[✗]");    // the above did not work.
* A data structure serving Duke by storing a list of tasks.
// contains the task list e.g., it has operations to add/delete tasks in the list
* Constructor to create TaskList if we have a set of tasks for it.
* Set our task to what was loaded from our file.
* @param tasks Tasks that were loaded from file.
* Returns the number of tasks in our list.
* @param num Position of a task in the list.
System.out.print("Nice, I've marked this as done:");
throw new InvalidFormatException("Enter \"done number\", make sure number exists in list!");
* Removes an existing task from our list.
* @param num Position of a task in the list.
System.out.format("You now have %d tasks in the list\n", getTaskCount());
throw new InvalidFormatException("Enter \"delete number\", make sure number exists in list!");
* Prints all our existing tasks, and their details.
* Behavior when tasks is empty depends on whether the list was created from loading file.
? "Nothing at the moment, you're all good."
: "No existing tasks has description that fits the keyword.");
* Adds a new task based on instructions given.
* @param instArr Array that represents the instruction.
// exception to handle non existence of /by and correspondingly /at
throw new InvalidFormatException("correct format: deadline task /by date");
String dateTime = String.join(" ", Arrays.copyOfRange(instArr, seperator + 1, instArr.length));
throw new InvalidFormatException("Make sure you entered valid date: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm");
throw new InvalidFormatException("correct format: event task /at place");

System.out.format("You now have %d tasks in the list\n", getTaskCount());
* Returns a TaskList, tasks with description that contains keyword are included.

* A minimalistic task that only contains a description.

private static final String DIVIDER = new String(new char[50]).replace('\0', '_');

private static final String EXIT_MESSAGE = "Goodbye, see you again!";
